thread.title: Amazon Funds 12 University Teams To Make Alexa More 'Social' 11/15/2016
thread.title_full: Amazon Funds 12 University Teams To Make Alexa More 'Social' 11/15/2016

posts.author: mediapost.com
posts.title: Amazon Funds 12 University Teams To Make Alexa More 'Social' 11/15/2016
posts.text:
After launching a $2.5 million initiative for university teams to further develop AI-driven conversational bots last month, Amazon just selected the teams it plans to sponsor for the challenge.
Amazon received applications from more than 100 teams at universities across 22 countries. 
As a result, Amazon selected 12 teams instead of 10 to receive a $100,000 stipend to develop their AI bots. Most of the teams selected are in the U.S. with others from Canada, the U.K., Italy, and Czech Republic. 
The Alexa Prize, which launched last month , is a competition for university teams to develop ‘socialbots’ on Amazon’s Alexa AI platform that can hold a natural conversation with humans. Amazon initially planned to sponsor 10 teams to explore and further develop different areas of conversational artificial intelligence, such as natural language processing and common sense reasoning. 
Throughout the course of the next year, the 12 teams will develop their bots and the winning team will win $500,000. Additionally, if the winning team’s bot can ‘converse coherently and engagingly with humans on popular topics for 20 minutes,’ Amazon plans to award a $1 million research grant to that team’s university. 
“For the Socialbot Challenge, the goal is to build an Alexa skill that will converse with people about trending societal topics and events in a turn-by-turn format,” an Amazon spokesperson told the IoT Daily. 
“In order for machines to be truly intelligent, they must be able to participate in conversation, demonstrating an understanding of the world and cultural moments.” 
Amazon appears to not have a focus on any potential marketing and advertising implications of conversational AI bots. 
“The use cases for socialbots are not for marketing or advertising; instead, the goal is to make Alexa even more engaging and enable students to advance their research in this area,” Amazon told the Daily. 
However, some brands have already been using such bots for marketing and advertising purposes. 
For example, agency executives discussed using chatbots to engage with consumers on behalf of brands at the MediaPost OMMA Bots and Chat conference during Advertising Week. 
In that panel discussion, Natalie Monbiot, senior vice president and managing partner of strategic innovation at UM, said her team created a chatbot last year for a client as part of a broader campaign. 
The chatbot was designed to engage with consumers as one of the characters of a new movie and received high engagement rates. On average, consumers engaged with the chatbot for 10 minutes, but some conversations were as long as two and a half hours, according to Monbiot. 
Here are the university teams selected for the Alexa Prize challenge: 
Carnegie-Mellon University (two teams) 
Princeton University 
Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute 
University of California, Berkeley 
University of California, Santa Cruz 
University of Washington 
University of Montreal 
University of Edinburgh 
Heriot-Watt University 
University of Trento 
Czech Technical University, Prague

posts.text:
Print Save Photo: Courtesy of KitchenAid 
Amazon’s getting a head start on holiday shopping, launching its Black Friday Deals Store this week. The deals cover just about every Amazon department—including, of course, kitchen goods and barware . The deals are updated every day and sometimes even more often than that, so, shoppers, beware: If you see something you like, don’t dillydally. RELATED How to Stock Your Holiday Bar like an Adult » 
The online shopping giant has also launched its gift guides with product picks from the likes of Deb Perelman of Smitten Kitchen .We dug through the deals and found solid buys, from kitchen scales to Le Creuset Dutch ovens to shiny barware .

posts.author: Derrick Miyao
posts.title: Tuesday’s best deals and discount codes: All of your home Wi-Fi problems solved with Amazon’s Deal of the Day
posts.text:
By Derrick Miyao 
Happy Tuesday! 
Are you excited to see family and friends next week for Thanksgiving? If you are the cook and want to try something new, I highly recommend spatchcocking your turkey. You can have an evenly cooked, golden brown turkey (without basting or frying) in about 90 minutes. I didn’t believe until I tried it, but everytime I cook one I become the hero of Thanksgiving. Check out this article on how to spatchcock a Turkey . Practice on a whole chicken this weekend if you want to try it first. 

Deals are picking up before Black Friday and Cyber Monday. I’ve mentioned before that some of the best sales will be happening this week. They’ll be one offs that will go quick as retailers try to clear inventory before next year. Retailers take advantage of the massive hype around the two major sales days and quietly raise prices on products in combination with deep discounted gadgets. It is this week when you will quietly see fantastic deals. 
Have slow or dead spots of Wi-Fi in your home? When you switch rooms, do you notice lag or buffering on your streaming music? Or do you have children who you are trying to protect from the crazy sites on the internet? Or limited their internet usage altogether? 
Today’s sale is better than what you will get on Black Friday for next generation routers. 
The Starry Station is a huge upgrade in current router technology. It takes less than five minutes to set up and will give you deeper security, while also giving you the ability to create parental controls for specific devices in your home. It also has a very strong signal for reaching to the far corners of your home. At $224, it still might seem pricey but consider it an investment in the internet service you already pay for. It’s also at a historic low price. 
Next up is the single pack of the Luma Home Wi-Fi system. Remember Google’s announcement of its own next generation Wi-Fi system that it has yet to release? Luma’s system does the same thing and at $99 it is $30 cheaper than Google’s unreleased product. You can buy multiple Lumas to spread throughout your home to create a mesh network. Repeaters are a hassle and just don’t work as well. You won’t find a cheaper price on the Luma all year. 
If you have large homes, or homes with thick walls, these systems are designed just for you. They work. I’ve been testing a wide range of these products and will have full reviews in the upcoming weeks. 
You all have a wonderful day. Featured deals of the day 
Starry Station – Touchscreen WiFi Router – $224 at Amazon (save $76) The touchscreen router that makes fast WiFi easy to use and set up Fast, whole-home WiFi: Better gaming, streaming and surfing Fast home WiFi: Better gaming, streaming and surfing Easy WiFi Parental Controls: Block usage on certain devices with just one tap Never Wait On Hold: Request a call directly from the touchscreen or message via the app Automatic Updates: Overnight updates deliver new and improved product features Know Your Speed: Auto speed checks powered by speedtest.net let you know if you get the level of internet service you pay for Works with all internet providers, modems and service types (cable, DSL, fiber, etc.); WPA2 Encryption Luma Home WiFi System (1 Pack) – $99.99 at Amazon (save $50) Get speed everywhere with the fastest WiFi in every corner of your home, on all of your devices, all at once Control your network with pause the internet, daily time limits and keep your kids out of harm’s way by setting content filter ratings (G, PG, PG-13, R, U) Lock down your home internet with enterprise-grade, cybersecurity that blocks hackers, malware and unknown devices 24 hours a day, 7 days a week Expansion capability allows you to add more Lumas at any time and automatic updates ensure your network is always getting smarter and stronger Integrated with Amazon Echo/Alexa and compatible with all WiFi capable devices Bose SoundLink Mini Bluetooth Speaker II – $179.99 at Amazon (save $20) Bose rarely puts the Soundlink Mini II speaker on sale. It’s one of the best sounding wireless speakers on the planet with Bose’ signature tuning. It has a deep woofer in back with drivers up front that give it a complete sound profile anyone would love. I bought one for my mom and she uses it everyday. At $20 off, this is the best price you will see all year. Wireless and ultra-compact so you can take Bose sound anywhere Built-in speakerphone lets you take calls out loud Voice prompts talk you through Bluetooth pairing, so it’s super easy Lithium-ion battery plays up to 10 hours on full charge Nest Protect smoke & carbon monoxide alarm, Wired (2nd gen) – $94 at Amazon (save $6) Carbon Monoxide is a silent killer. It’s an odorless substance that slowly deprives you of oxygen and can make you violently sick or even kill you. Incidents of carbon monoxide poisoning sky rocket as the temperature drops. People turn on their heaters which haven’t been used all summer, and that’s when exhaust or malfunctions occur that increase the levels of CO. The Nest Protect rarely goes on sale, just like all Nest products, so at a $6 savings, this deal is better than nothing. I wanted to list this deal because CO poisoning happens a lot more frequently than it should and a simple investment can protect you and your loved ones. The smaller the body the faster they are to poisoning. KMASHI External 5000mAh Battery – $5.99 at Amazon with discount code AM8MQ8GY (save $5) One of the most boring accessories to write about is battery packs. But they are almost as essential as our smartphones since many of us run out of power by the end of the day. KMASHI’s 5000mAh portable power bank is a solid choice of size versus power. It’s small enough to keep in a front pocket while having enough power to get most phones two full charges. That’s enough power to keep your phone going for three days if you start with a full battery on your smartphone. With the travel season starting in two weeks, you might want to grab this battery pack since it is just $5.99. If you need more power you can get the larger KMASHI 10000mAh sibling for $9.20 when you apply discount code 2C9Y8NG4 at checkout. Echo Dot – Buy 3 and save $20 at Amazon , use discount code DOT3PACK 
Amazon was the first to make a speaker for the smart home. The Amazon Echo Dot is the cheapest of the bunch and arguably the most versatile. While the Amazon Echo and Google Home are both all-in-one smart speakers, their speakers actually aren’t the best performers. The Echo Dot is a fraction of the price starting at $49.99, making it $80 cheaper than the Google Home and $120 cheaper than the Echo. You can connect it to your own speakers as long as they have a 3.5mm audio jack. Right now for the first time ever, Amazon is running a promotion where you can save $20 on a pack of three which makes it the exact same price as the Google Home. That means you can put an Echo Dot in your bedroom, office and kitchen. They will also make for fantastic gifts this holiday season. 
It can set alarms, play music, news and audiobooks, control smart home products, and even order a pizza and an Uber taxi ride. Philips 456194 Hue White and Color Ambiance Starter Kit, 3 A19 Bulbs and 1 Bridge, 2nd Generation, Works with Amazon Alexa – $139.81 at Amazon (save $40) Starter kit includes 3 color LED light bulbs and a bridge that wirelessly connects up to 50 lights The bridge enables you to control your lights from your smart device via the Philips Hue App. Add Hue accessories or connect to Alexa to control your lights your way 2nd Generation starter kit comes with brighter bulbs (upgraded from 600 to 800 lumens) and more internal storage for lighting scenes. Works with Alexa for voice control. Also works with Apple HomeKit, Nest and SmartThings (hub required) Choose from 16 million colors and play with color. Sync your lights with your music, TV and games for an immersive effect Smartphones Moto X Pure Edition Unlocked Smartphone – $292 at Amazon (works on all carriers and will be getting Android 7.0 Nougat ) Carrier freedom: Moto X Pure Edition is unlocked and works on all major networks 5.7″ Quad HD display + stereo sound: Immerse yourself in entertainment with a vivid, edge-to-edge display that’s enhanced by rich stereo sound. 21 MP camera: Take crystal-clear pictures and get great results in any light. TurboPower charging: Get the world’s fastest charging with TurboPower™ technology for up to 10 hours of use in just 15 minutes of charging. All-day battery: Power through the day without stopping to recharge. Advanced water protection: Never let spills, splashes, or rain stand in the way of using your phone. Pure Android™ experience: Android™ as it was intended—without unnecessary clutter from preloaded apps or software. Moto G Play (4th gen.) – Black – 16GB – Unlocked – $99.99 at Amazon (save $50, and works on all four major carriers in the US) Fast 4G LTE speed, an up to 1.2 GHz quad-core processor, 2 GB of RAM, and a bright 5″ HD (720p) display ensure videos and games run smoothly and look great Enjoy the best of Google Android 6.0 Marshmallow, including Google Play Store, Google Maps, Gmail and more Offers and ads, including personalized deals and recommendations, display on the phone’s lockscreen Shoot photos with an 8 MP camera in back and take selfies with a 5 MP camera in front. Includes 16 GB of internal storage plus add up to 128 GB more with a microSD card Includes a 2800 mAh battery, so you can go from morning to night without worrying about battery life Unlocked and carrier-friendly, works with all major carrier networks domestically or abroad Wearables Samsung Gear S2 – Classic Platinum – $349.99 at Amazon (save $100) Timeless platinum plated case Matching 20mm genuine Leather Strap in Black (small and large included in box) Connectivity – Wi-Fi : 802.11 b/g/n 2.4 GHZ, Bluetooth : Bluetooth v4.1, Bluetooth Profiles: A2DP, AVRCP Intuitive circular interface and rotating bezel for easy navigation, Access to important notifications, texts, and updates at a glance Compatible with many Android smartphones Version 4.4 or greater Pebble Time Smartwatch – $81.99 at Amazon (save $68) Notifications at a glance: calendar events, text and emails, incoming calls, and more. Includes Pebble Health, a built-in activity and sleep tracker with daily reports and weekly insights. Water resistant to 30 meters Built-In microphone for voice notes and quick replies Choose from thousands of watch faces and apps in the Pebble App Store with more added every day. (Please note that sending replies works with AT&T iPhone accounts, and most major Android apps including SMS, Hangouts, Gmail, Facebook Messenger, Whatapp and hundreds more. iOS voice features for other carriers will be available in a future software update.). WORKS WITH ANDRIOD 4.3 OR ABOVE Audio Mpow Thor Bluetooth Headphones – $18.99 at Amazon with discount code ABMWNBBG (save $5) HIGH FIDELITY STEREO SOUND: Featured with noise cancelling technology, our headset provides you high fidelity stereo music. Noise cancelling microphone further guarantees clear sound for hands-free calls. ULTRA LONG PLAYING TIME: Powerful rechargeable battery provides up to 8 hours playing time. FOLDABLE & PORTABLE: Designed with portability and storage. An extra storage bag is offered for carrying convenience. BOTH WIRED and WIRELESS: By connected with an audio cable, the product can be used as wired headphone when the battery is powered off. CHOETECH Sweatproof Sports Wireless Bluetooth V4.1 Earbuds – $22.99 at Amazon with discount code LMO5QHHR (save $16) CHOETECH is a brand we regularly feature on AG for its great prices and high-quality products. Its latest sports earbuds are designed for sports use with an IPX5 sweatproof rating, and Bluetooth 4.1 to ensure a strong wireless signal. There’s also built in noise cancelling into the microphone which is a necessity if you plan on taking calls with the earbuds. At $22.99, the CHOETECH earbuds are a solid value for those who are not looking to spend copious amount of money on accessories. CHOETECH Sweatproof Sport Wireless Bluetooth V4.1 Earbuds – $19.99 at Amazon with discount code RVOXL8OT (save $14) Latest Bluetooth V4.1 Technology: Features much lower power consumption, more stable signal transmission, clearer sound production. Built-in microphone, supports hands-free calling. Lightweight & Sweat-proof: Rare small headphones, more comfortable and less burden. Comfortable & Stable Fit: Included eartips and ear hooks of different sizes to ensure a comfortable and secure fit for you. Cables, chargers and other accessories Coolest Cooler – $174.95 at Amazon (save $274) The Coolest Cooler was one of the most popular crowdfunding campaign in recent history. thread.title: Hyundai adds Amazon's Alexa to its Blue Link connected cars
thread.title_full: Hyundai adds Amazon's Alexa to its Blue Link connected cars

posts.title: Hyundai adds Amazon's Alexa to its Blue Link connected cars
posts.text:
Hyundai adds Amazon's Alexa to its Blue Link connected cars Start your car from your living room, or switch your lights on before you get home. Share Save 
It's no fun starting your commute by going at your car with an ice scraper on a frosty morning. If you own a 2016 Hyundai, you won't have to -- at least if you have an Amazon Echo at home. The car-maker has baked Amazon's Alexa virtual assistant into its Blue Link connected car app . This means you can start your car, and set the temperature (among other things) from the warm embrace of your comforter using just your voice starting today. 
Hyundai isn't the first to think about connecting its cars to Amazon's smarthome kit. Back at CES in January, Ford announced it'd be integrating Alexa with its SYNC platform. That still hasn't come to pass, though. Hyundai still isn't technically the first, with its own luxury Marque -- Genesis -- adding the same functionality back in August . At least now, those of us without the budget for a G80, or G90 can get in on the action. 
What can you do from the driver's seat of your new Hyundai? Most of the things you'd imagine, which include starting/stopping your car, setting the climate control, lock or unlock the doors, toggle the lights, or even set off the horn (for scaring the bejeezus out of the mail carrier, we assume). There's no option to locate your car right now, but Hyundai tells us that's in the works. If you're familiar with Blue Link, you'll know that much of this functionality is already in the app, Hyundai's just adding in another layer of convenience. 
You'll need to be a paying user of Blue Link of course, which costs $99 a month, but if you are, you're good to go starting today. Hyundai says that all 2017 vehicles will be compatible, and most of its 2016 lineup too. There are even a few 2015 models that will get the feature too, so be sure to check to see if your car made the cut. By James Trew @itstrew Originally from Bristol, UK, and currently based in Spain, James began writing for music magazines in the '90s. After a few failed attempts at a DJ career, he'd carve out a living reviewing DJ and music production gear. Now, it's more about drones, fitness tech, and culture. Though he keeps his DJ gear plugged in and on show. You never know. 6 Shares

thread.title: Review of the best-selling earbud headphones on Amazon
thread.title_full: Review of the best-selling earbud headphones on Amazon - Business Insider

posts.author: Brandt Ranj
posts.title: Review of the best-selling earbud headphones on Amazon
posts.text:
The Insider Picks team writes about stuff we think you'll like. Business Insider has affiliate partnerships, so we may get a share of the revenue from your purchase.
Amazon
In the tech world, it's hard to find cheap products that are universally praised.
But Panasonic has done it. The company's sub-$10 headphones have gotten over 25,000 5-star ratings on Amazon .
Make no mistake, these are no-frill earbuds. They don't have a mic for voice calls, and their L-shaped headphone jack might make them a no-go depending on your phone's case.
Still, people really seem to like how they sound.
Runners have ran with them, audio engineers have put them to the test, and those who've ruined their first pair in the wash have gone back and bought a second.
Buying multiple pairs of these headphones was actually a common theme in many of the reviews. People like the sound of these so much that they've bought a spare pair in case Panasonic stops selling them.
Most of the reviews are vague about the sound quality, saying they're "good" or "great" or "clean" or "clear." Some more in-depth reviews describe their sound as a little extra bassy, but not enough to annoy you. The midrange and highs seem to be praised, too; so these should perform well regardless of your preferred genre of music.
Basically, if you have an idea in your head of what $10 headphones should sound like, it seems like these perform better than that.
Another compliment these earbuds got consistently is that they're really good at staying in your ears. That can be a problem with gummy-tipped earbuds like these, but apparently they stay in even when you're running. Panasonic includes two different-sized tips in the packaging, so if you haven't had problems with earbuds like these before, you probably won't with these.
Nobody in the reviews said that these were the be-all and end-all of headphones. They seem to be perfect for people who want a cheap set of earbuds that don't sound or feel cheap. If you're into audio, these might surprise you, as they've surprised the audiophiles that have given them a shot.
Panasonic ErgoFit In-Ear Earbud Headphones, $10.93, available at Amazon
This article was originally published on 10/7/2016.

This does not drive our decision as to whether or not a product is featured or recommended. We operate independently from our advertising sales team. We welcome your feedback. posts.text: Amazon opens fulfillment center, to hire 350 workers Published 1:22 pm, Tuesday, November 15, 2016 PITTSTON, Pa. (AP) — The online retail giant Amazon says it has opened a nearly-400,000-square-foot building in northeastern Pennsylvania and is hiring 350 warehouse positions. The (Wilkes-Barre) Citizens' Voice ( http://bit.ly/2fW7su3 ) reports that Amazon opened a fulfillment center in CenterPoint Commerce and Trade Park West in Pittston Township. A Pennsylvania CareerLink Luzerne County spokeswoman says the company is recruiting for warehouse positions that pay $13 an hour. A spokesman inside the building and a representative of Mericle Commercial Real Estate Services both referred questions to Amazon's corporate headquarters, which didn't immediately respond to requests for comment. posts.title: Amazon opens fulfillment center, to hire 350 workers
posts.text:
PITTSTON, Pa. (AP) — The online retail giant Amazon says it has opened a nearly-400,000-square-foot building in northeastern Pennsylvania and is hiring 350 warehouse positions.
The (Wilkes-Barre) Citizens' Voice ( http://bit.ly/2fW7su3 ) reports that Amazon opened a fulfillment center in CenterPoint Commerce and Trade Park West in Pittston Township.
A Pennsylvania CareerLink Luzerne County spokeswoman says the company is recruiting for warehouse positions that pay $13 an hour.
A spokesman inside the building and a representative of Mericle Commercial Real Estate Services both referred questions to Amazon's corporate headquarters, which didn't immediately respond to requests for comment.
Gov. Tom Wolf has said Amazon wants to add at least 5,000 new full-time jobs in the state over the next few years.
___
Information from: The Citizens' Voice, http://www.citizensvoice.com
